Hahaha it is mate :P my first 2 weeks in a row off since I left college after getting my BTEC... 

Yeah I totally get what you mean with weathering a scene and trying to tell a story with the frame, that’s exactly what I really enjoy about vfx. All the little details we add that no one will probably ever notice :wink:. 

At DNEG, DMP (or Digital Matte Painting) is it’s own department. They use photoshop to paint up scenes. Then use Nuke to project them out into 3D space. As far as I’m aware, at other studios, including smaller ones, comp artists will do their own DMPs. 

These then get picked up by comp and placed in the shot using roto and other comp techniques to make it look real. 

Sometimes in DMP they get to do really exciting full landscapes and other times they just have to paint up a pretty sky that’s going to be really blurry in the back of a blue screen shot. I’ll see if I can find a shot from DNEGTVs showreel and show you which bits are scan. which are DMP, and which are comp.

Happy days with the deadline. you’ve got a fair bit of time to get something looking really nice.

I was in Budapest for a few days and then off too Scotland to see my Dad next week!
